title: Truffle test can not handle named argument constructors in another file

body:
>SyntaxError: Expected "!", "!=", "(", ")", "+", "++", "-", "--", "0", "<", "<=", "==", ">", ">=", "[", "^", "delete", "false", "hex", "mapping", "new", "this", "true", "v", "~", [1-9], comment, end of line, identifier, number, string, or whitespace but "{" found. Line: 12, Column: 26
    at peg$buildStructuredError (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/cli.bundled.js:294335:12)

@bmaurer Thanks for reporting this. 

The error here is related to Truffle's use of a deprecated parser for solidity tests. Should be resolved with [truffle-compile 42](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle-compile/pull/42) which is scheduled to be published in a patch release later this week. 

Closing as a duplicate of #707 but please feel free to re-open if you discover there's an additional problem for this constructor case.
